title: French Inflation Eases to Lowest Rate Since 2020 on Energy
content: France’s inflation rate dropped further below the European Central Bank’s 2% target, reaching a more than four-year low and adding to arguments that borrowing costs can be cut further.

title: Swiss Exports to US Plummet in First Month of Trump Tariffs
content: Swiss exports to the US plummeted in April, showing the fallout from President Donald Trump’s tariff policy.

title: US’s Cerberus Floated Bid For Chinese-Owned Port of Darwin
content: US private equity firm Cerberus Capital Management LP expressed interest in purchasing the lease for Australia’s strategically important Port of Darwin from Landbridge Group, despite the Chinese firm insisting it has no interest in selling the asset.

title: Zimbabwe Sees $2.6 Billion Bridge Finance Secured in 2026
content: Zimbabwe expects $2.6 billion in bridge finance — needed to repay debt owed to international financial institutions and regain access to capital markets — to be in place by the first quarter of next year, Finance Minister Mthuli Ncube said.

title: What's Zuckerberg Getting From His Shift Toward Trump?
content: Mark Zuckerberg, the chief executive officer of Meta Platforms Inc., seems to have taken actions to make the company more Trump-friendly. Since November, Zuckerberg has already had a string of postelection get-togethers with Donald Trump and made multiple trips to Mar-a-Lago in Florida. Meta also donated $1 million to the inauguration, and Zuckerberg co-hosted a black-tie reception that evening in Trump’s honor. Bloomberg's Charlie Wells discuss this and what this means for Zuckerberg and Meta. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Treasuries Rally With Japan Bonds as MOF News Boosts Sentiment
content: A rally in Japan’s bond market has spilled over to US Treasuries, as signs that Japanese authorities may look to re-establish stability after a tumultuous period fuel a spate of bond buying across global markets.

title: Blockchain.com Seeks Africa Expansion as Crypto Rules Emerge
content: Blockchain.com, a UK-based crypto exchange, is seeking to expand in African nations that have started to institute rules to regulate the industry.

title: EU To 'Fast Track' US Talks; Gaza's Food Plan | Horizons Middle East & Africa 05/27/2025
content: Horizons Middle East & Africa is your daily spotlight on one of the world's fastest-growing regions. Live from Dubai, we bring you the latest global markets and analysis, plus news-making interviews, with a special focus on MEA. All that and more, as you head to the office in the Gulf, pause for lunch in Hong Kong, or start your day in London or Johannesburg.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: The Euro And The Yuan To Challenge Dollar Dominance?
content: President Trump’s determination to disrupt the global financial order continues to sour investor sentiment toward the dollar. Both the EU and China are seeing an opportunity to make their currencies more important to global trade. We discuss the possibility of King Dollar being dethroned with PWC Partner & Chief Economist Alexis Crow (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Japan’s MOF Is Said to Sound Out Market on Bond Sale Amounts
content: Japan’s super-long bond yields slid sharply after the finance ministry sounded out market participants on appropriate issuance amounts following a recent slump in the nation’s sovereign debt.

title: Global Bonds, Dollar Gain on Japan Debt Plan: Markets Wrap
content: Bonds rallied worldwide after Japan indicated it’s looking to stabilize its debt market after weeks of selloff. The dollar rebounded.

title: Lagarde Touts Euro’s Global Role During Speech in Berlin
content: European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said there is an opportunity to strengthen the euro’s international role and allow the currency bloc to enjoy more of the privileges so far reserved for the US. “Europe has many of the key ingredients for success, but they need to be brought together,” Lagarde said May 26 during a speech in Berlin. Bloomberg’s Mark Cudmore repots.

title: Gold Extends Losses as EU-US Trade Talks Weigh on Haven Demand
content: Gold extended declines as the dollar swung to a gain and demand for haven assets cooled, with investors also weighing prospects for improving trade relations between the US and the EU.

title: Coal India to Take First Unit Public With Consultancy Firm IPO
content: Coal India Ltd. will sell as much as 10% of its holding in mining consultancy unit Central Mine Planning & Design Institute Ltd. (CMPDI) through an initial public offering.

title: Malaysia Stirs ‘Hotpot Diplomacy’ With Palm-Based Fat for China
content: Malaysia is seeking to expand its palm oil market in China by offering a plant-based alternative for use in mala hotpot, a popular spicy dish that’s cooked with raw meats and vegetables in a simmering pot.

title: UK Stocks Rally While Bonds Surge After Holiday
Insight with Haslinda Amin 5/27/2025
content: Insight with Haslinda Amin, a daily news program featuring in-depth, high-profile interviews and analysis to give viewers the complete picture on the stories that matter. The show features prominent leaders spanning the worlds of business, finance, politics and culture. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Hong Kong Bourse Plans to Start Zero-Day Options in 2026
content: Hong Kong’s stock exchange is seeking to launch options that expire within a day as early as the first half of 2026, bringing to the Asian hub an instrument that has driven a boom in US derivatives in recent years.

title: Bloomberg: The China Show 5/27/2025
content: “Bloomberg: The China Show” is your definitive source for news and analysis on the world's second-biggest economy. From politics and policy to tech and trends, Yvonne Man and David Ingles give global investors unique insight, delivering in-depth discussions with the newsmakers who matter. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Oil Steadies as Traders Focus on EU Trade Talks, OPEC+ Meeting
content: Oil was steady as the market weighed the prospect for easing trade tensions between the European Union and the US ahead of an OPEC+ meeting that will make a decision on supply policy.

title: HSBC Cuts Dozens of Analyst Jobs in Investment Banking Overhaul
content: HSBC Holdings Plc has culled more than two dozen analysts in recent days as Europe’s largest lender deepens a restructuring of its investment banking businesses, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Mitsui OSK Lines CEO on Trade Tariffs Impact
content:
Takeshi Hashimoto, President and CEO at Mitsui OSK Lines, discusses the company's business strategy and the impact from the trade tariffs. He speaks with Haidi Stroud-Watts and Paul Allen on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade". 

 (Source: Bloomberg)

title: How Australia Plans to Fix Its Poor Productivity
content:
Australia’s Productivity Commission says the country's productivity growth is at its "lowest ebb in 60 years" and has identified 15 priority reforms. The commission seeking input on changes for sectors including corporate tax, carbon targets, and student results. Deputy chair Alex Robson talks about the initiatives on 'Bloomberg: The Asia Trade.'
 (Source: Bloomberg)

title: IndiGo’s Gangwal Raises $1.4 Billion From Upsized Stake Sale
content: Rakesh Gangwal, the co-founder of India’s largest airline IndiGo, and his family trust raised 115.6 billion rupees ($1.4 billion) from the upsized sale of a 5.7% stake in the carrier, further cutting the billionaire’s holding in operator InterGlobe Aviation Ltd.

title: Southern China Braces for Heavy Rain as Wheat Belt Drought Eases
content: Southern China is bracing for heavy rain that’s set to replenish soil moisture in some parched agricultural regions, following storms last week that provided relief for wheat farmers in the north of the country.

title: Kenyan Growth to Slow on Debt, Fiscal Pressures, World Bank Says
content: Kenya’s economic growth rate is expected to slow for the second straight year amid headwinds from tight public finances and high debt levels, the World Bank said.

title: Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 05/27/2025
content: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Sydney with Paul Allen and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Thai Billionaire Hands Stakes in Major Companies to Children
content: Thailand’s second-richest person Charoen Sirivadhanabhakdi transferred ownership of two major listed companies to his five children as the octogenarian businessman pulls back from day-to-day management of his beer-to-property conglomerate.

title: Hedge Funds Bet on Korean Won to Mirror Taiwan Dollar Surge
content: Hedge funds are ramping up bets in the options market that the South Korean won will mirror the Taiwan dollar’s recent rally against the greenback.

title: HK's Gaw Capital New Fund to Invest in China, Japan
content: Real estate-focused private equity firm Gaw Capital is looking use its new fund that could be worth $2 billion to invest in China, Japan, Australia and Vietnam. Gaw Capital Managing Principal and Global Head of Capital Markets, Christina Gaw, discusses her outlook for commercial property in Hong Kong and mainland China with David Ingles and Yvonne Man on "Bloomberg: The China Show."  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Macron Courts Southeast Asia Nations Trapped by US-China Dispute
content: French President Emmanuel Macron is spearheading the latest effort by European leaders to woo Southeast Asian nations worried about becoming collateral damage in the US trade war and security disputes between Washington and Beijing.

title: US’s Cerberus Floated Bid For Chinese-Owned Port of Darwin
content: US private equity firm Cerberus Capital Management LP expressed interest in purchasing the lease for Australia’s strategically important Port of Darwin from Landbridge Group, despite the Chinese firm insisting it has no interest in selling the asset.

title: Japan Government Panel Warns on Rising Yields’ Hit on Finances
content: A Japanese government advisory panel urged authorities to step up fiscal consolidation efforts, as the Bank of Japan’s ongoing monetary tightening efforts raise the risk of higher debt-servicing costs for the world’s most indebted developed nation.

title: Malaysia Sees Reducing the US’s Proposed Tariff to 10% as a Good Outcome
content: The US reducing its proposed tariffs on Malaysia to a 10% baseline would be seen as a positive move, Investment, Trade and Industry Minister Zafrul Aziz said, conceding that a previously hoped for levy of zero may not be possible.

title: North Korea Says Trump’s Golden Dome Risks ‘Space Nuclear War’
content: North Korea sharply criticized President Donald Trump’s plan for a Golden Dome missile-defense system, a shield intended to counter threats from rivals including Pyongyang.

title: Why This River in India and Pakistan Is Causing So Much Angst
content: The suspension of a water-sharing agreement in place for 65 years signals a new low in relations between the nations.

title: Bolsonaro’s Son Investigated Over Alleged Court Intimidation
content: A Brazilian Supreme Court justice has authorized the federal police to investigate one of the sons of former President Jair Bolsonaro over allegations that he sought to intimidate members of the court while in the US.

title: UK to Train 120,000 Builders, Carers to Cut Reliance on Migrants
content: The UK government plans to train 120,000 British builders, engineers and care workers as it tries to curb migration without worsening skill shortages.

title: Milei Beefs With Netflix Star Over Price of a Dozen Empanadas
content: President Javier Milei and his finance chief criticized a globally known Argentine actor for complaining that the country’s staple food was overpriced, stirring debate about how expensive Argentina has become in dollar terms.

title: Israel-Backed Gaza Food Plan Starts Amid Dissent, Delay
content: The Gaza Humanitarian Foundation, a new Swiss-based nonprofit, said it began distributing food to Palestinians in the war-ravaged Gaza Strip and appointed a new executive director following earlier setbacks.

title: Mark Zuckerberg Loves MAGA Now. Will MAGA Ever Love Him Back?
content: Meta’s CEO has done everything he can to win over Trump, and it’s not clear how much he has to show for it.

title: Trump to Pardon Sheriff Found Guilty of ‘Cash-for-Badges’ Scheme
content: President Donald Trump said he would be pardoning a former Virginia sheriff facing a 10-year prison sentence after being convicted of bribery and fraud charges.

title: King Charles Visits Canada as Country Rattled by Trump Taunts
content: King Charles III arrived in Canada to open a new parliamentary session at the invitation of Prime Minister Mark Carney, a move designed in part to send a message to US President Donald Trump about the northern country’s sovereignty.

title: Multiple People Taken to Hospitals After Shooting Incident in South Carolina Beach Town
content: LITTLE RIVER, S.C. (AP) — Ten people were shot during a fight that started after a private boat hosting a holiday weekend party arrived at a dock Sunday night on the South Carolina coast, authorities said.

title: US Money Managers Put on Notice by $65 Billion Dutch Investor
content: Dutch pension fund PME is issuing a blanket warning to US money managers, amid concerns America’s investment industry is caving in to pressure from the Trump administration to abandon basic principles of stewardship.

title: South Korean Election: Can a New President Bring Back Stability?
content: South Koreans are set to finally choose a new president after the nation’s worst constitutional crisis in decades.

title: Charles Rangel, a Voice for the Poor in Tax Debates, Dies at 94
content: Charles Rangel, the dapper, voluble US congressman from New York’s Harlem district who for four decades used his perch on the House tax-writing committee to advocate for inner cities and the people who live there, has died. He was 94.

title: Macron Says Shoving Incident on Plane Was Him and Wife ‘Joking’
content: PARIS (AP) — They were just playfighting.

title: Chile’s Leftist Presidential Hopefuls Spar Over SQM-Codelco Deal
content: Chile’s left-leaning presidential contenders clashed over a landmark deal signed last year between lithium supplier SQM and state-owned Codelco, highlighting differences ahead of the sector’s primary vote.

title: NATO Chief Rutte Says Members Moving Toward 5% Spending Target
content: NATO Secretary General Mark Rutte confirmed the alliance will seek to adopt a new defense spending target of 5% of GDP at a June summit, meeting a demand by US President Donald Trump that had originally seemed unrealistic.

title: Suriname Election Deadlocks With Newfound Oil Bonanza at Stake
content: Suriname’s political future hangs in the balance after the two main parties were virtually tied in Sunday’s election, triggering intense coalition talks to determine who will get to manage the upcoming oil bonanza.

title: Merz Gives Ukraine Green Light to Strike Deep Inside Russia
content: German Chancellor Friedrich Merz said Ukraine has been given permission to use weapons supplied by its allies to launch strikes deep inside Russia.

title: Trump Threatens to Send Harvard Grant Money to Trade Schools
content: President Donald Trump on Monday threatened to divert billions in grant dollars away from Harvard University and give those funds to trade schools across the US, escalating his clash with the elite institution.

title: EU Plans to ‘Fast Track’ Trade Talks With US Amid Tariff Fight
content: The European Union said it agreed to accelerate negotiations with the US to avoid a transatlantic trade war, signaling a more amicable approach just days after President Donald Trump criticized the bloc for taking advantage of the US and slow-walking talks.

title: Maduro Sweeps Venezuelan Regional Vote Marked by Low Turnout
content: Venezuela’s ruling party swept regional and parliamentary elections in a landslide Sunday, tightening President Nicolás Maduro’s grip on power after a low-turnout vote marred by widespread opposition abstention and international criticism.

title: Ukraine’s Zelenskiy Said to Meet With Merz in Berlin Wednesday
content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskiy is set to travel to Berlin Wednesday for talks with Chancellor Friedrich Merz, according to a person familiar with his plans.

title: Germany’s Merz Floats Cutting Off EU Funds to Fico’s Slovakia
content: Germany would consider suspending European Union funding to Slovakia if the country continues to diverge from the bloc’s shared direction, according to Chancellor Friedrich Merz.

title: Germany Calls Ugandan Claims of Subversive Activities ‘Absurd’
content: Germany said allegations that its ambassador to Uganda was involved in subversive activities were “absurd,” after the East African nation said it was suspending military cooperation.

title: ‘Revenge Tax’: US Bill Hits Allies That Have Tax Rules Trump Doesn’t Like
content: Investors in nations with tax regimes that the US deems unfair would face higher tax rates on income earned in the US if the tax bill that’s making its way to the Senate becomes law.

title: Germany’s Merz Says US Tech Perks Could Be Target in Trade War
content: The European Union could retaliate against US technology companies if the trade conflict with Donald Trump’s administration escalates, German Chancellor Friedrich Merz said.

content: Malaysia is seeking to expand its palm oil market in China by offering a plant-based alternative for use in mala hotpot, a popular spicy dish that’s cooked with raw meats and vegetables in a simmering pot.

title: OPEC+ to Decide July Oil Production Levels on May 31
content: OPEC+ brought forward a video-conference that will decide July oil production levels by one day to May 31, delegates said. The eight-nation sub-group led by Saudi Arabia and Russia held preliminary talks last week on making another bumper output increase of about 411,000 barrels a day for a third consecutive month. Bloomberg’s Dan Murtaugh reports.

content: “Oh no. Not again!” The cycle of tariff threats is happening once more.

content: Seven & i Holdings Co. shareholders approved a new board at a low-key annual meeting, despite the drama surrounding a company facing a takeover proposal by Alimentation Couche-Tard Inc., the operator of Circle K stores.

title: Luxury Tokyo Penthouse Sold for Over $65 Million in Booming Market
content: A Tokyo penthouse developed by Swedish buyout firm EQT AB has sold for about ¥9.5 billion ($67 million), shedding light on the cost of buying into the city’s booming high-end property market.

title: China’s Air Conditioning Use Poised to Skyrocket This Summer
content: A surge in electricity demand could require a lot more coal to be burnt, fueling the cycle for even hotter summers in the years ahead.

title: Samsung Is Said in Talks to Invest in California-Based Exo
content: Samsung Electronics Co.’s investment arm is among a group of firms seeking to invest in US health-care software and device company Exo Imaging Inc., according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Meituan, JD.com’s Food Delivery War Worsens $100 Billion Rout
content: Shares of Meituan and JD.com have lost a combined $100 billion in market value since late last year, highlighting the fallout of a costly battle to win a bigger slice of the Chinese food delivery business.

title: HKBN’s CEO Says China Mobile Takeover Offer Undervalues Firm
content: China Mobile Ltd.’s takeover offer for HKBN Ltd. undervalues the company, according to the Hong Kong broadband provider’s top executive.

title: Meituan Warns Local Rivalry, Global Push to Hurt Profits
content: Meituan warned its profitability may suffer as the Chinese food delivery leader faces intensifying competition at home and is aggressively expanding into new markets.

title: ALS to Raise Up to A$390 Million to Grow Laboratory Network
content: Australia’s ALS Ltd. is seeking to raise up to A$390 million ($253 million) as the testing services company looks to expand its laboratory network.

title: Mark Zuckerberg Loves MAGA Now. Will MAGA Ever Love Him Back?
content: Meta’s CEO has done everything he can to win over Trump, and it’s not clear how much he has to show for it.

title: US Prosecutors Sought Builder.ai Data After Sales Overstated
content: US prosecutors demanded that Builder.ai hand over financial statements and other documents, signaling that the artificial intelligence company was facing legal scrutiny in the weeks before it went bust.

title: EU Tells Shein to Tackle Consumer Law Breaches or Face Fines
content: Shein Group Ltd., the Singapore-based e-commerce firm, was warned by European Union regulators it could face fines unless it clamps down on consumer protection violations on its platform.

title: ChatGPT’s Improved Memory Points Toward a More Personal AI
content: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Austin Carr reports on the improvements recently announced to the major consumer chatbots that have made it easier for them to know more about their users.

title: GMO Group Scraps $2 Billion Share Sale Plan of Internet Unit
content: The Japanese conglomerate GMO Internet Group Inc. canceled a planned share offering of one of its listed arms after the stock surged in recent months, pushing up the unit’s valuation.

title: OpenAI to Set Up Shop in South Korea to Spur Further Growth
content: OpenAI has established a legal entity in South Korea, seeking to propel further adoption of its artificial intelligence technologies.

title: China’s Meituan, Xiaomi See Long-Term Expansion Efforts in Spotlight
content: Meituan and Xiaomi Corp.’s long-term ambitions and investment plans will dominate this week’s earnings releases, continuing to shape sentiment for China’s tech sector.

title: Jony Ive’s OpenAI Deal Puts Pressure on Apple to Find Next Big Thing
content: Jony Ive’s deal with OpenAI should cause major shockwaves at Apple, especially after a design-team brain drain and struggles in artificial intelligence. Also: Apple plans Meta-like smart glasses for late next year, and Trump threatens a 25% smartphone tariff. Looking ahead to WWDC, we have the latest details on the company’s operating system redesign plan and what’s likely to be its biggest AI announcement.

title: Pakistan Allocates 2,000-MW Capacity to Power Bitcoin Mining
content: Pakistan has allocated 2,000 megawatts of electricity in the first phase of a national push to support Bitcoin mining and AI data centers, as the country moves to legalize cryptocurrency and attract foreign investments.

title: French Inflation Eases to Lowest Rate Since 2020 on Energy
content: France’s inflation rate dropped further below the European Central Bank’s 2% target, reaching a more than four-year low and adding to arguments that borrowing costs can be cut further.

title: Swiss Exports to US Plummet in First Month of Trump Tariffs
content: Swiss exports to the US plummeted in April, showing the fallout from President Donald Trump’s tariff policy.

title: Zimbabwe Sees $2.6 Billion Bridge Finance Secured in 2026
content: Zimbabwe expects $2.6 billion in bridge finance — needed to repay debt owed to international financial institutions and regain access to capital markets — to be in place by the first quarter of next year, Finance Minister Mthuli Ncube said.

title: Japan Government Panel Warns on Rising Yields’ Hit on Finances
content: A Japanese government advisory panel urged authorities to step up fiscal consolidation efforts, as the Bank of Japan’s ongoing monetary tightening efforts raise the risk of higher debt-servicing costs for the world’s most indebted developed nation.

title: Japan Loses Top Creditor Status for First Time in 34 Years
content: Japan lost its position as the world’s largest creditor nation for the first time in 34 years, despite posting a record amount of overseas assets.

title: Hungary to Hold Rates With Price Risks in Focus: Decision Guide
content: Hungary’s central bank will probably keep interest rates unchanged as policymakers focus on curbing inflation risks even as the government signals a worsening outlook for growth.

title: Malaysia Sees Reducing the US’s Proposed Tariff to 10% as a Good Outcome
content: The US reducing its proposed tariffs on Malaysia to a 10% baseline would be seen as a positive move, Investment, Trade and Industry Minister Zafrul Aziz said, conceding that a previously hoped for levy of zero may not be possible.

title: Ueda Indicates BOJ Is Still Eyeing More Rate Hikes, Boosting Yen
content: Bank of Japan Governor Kazuo Ueda gave the yen a boost by clearly indicating his intention to continue raising the benchmark interest rate if the economy improves as expected.

title: UK Food Inflation Highest in a Year as Grocers Face More Costs
content: UK food inflation nudged up in May to the highest level in a year, as British supermarkets battle higher operating costs stemming from the UK government’s revenue-raising budget.

title: Milei Beefs With Netflix Star Over Price of a Dozen Empanadas
content: President Javier Milei and his finance chief criticized a globally known Argentine actor for complaining that the country’s staple food was overpriced, stirring debate about how expensive Argentina has become in dollar terms.

title: Argentina Claims Return to Global Markets With Peso Bond Sale
content: Argentina’s government will issue a five-year bond denominated in pesos that’s aimed at international investors who are allowed to purchase it in US dollars, a move the government hailed as its return to global markets after a sovereign restructuring during the pandemic.

title: King Charles Visits Canada as Country Rattled by Trump Taunts
content: King Charles III arrived in Canada to open a new parliamentary session at the invitation of Prime Minister Mark Carney, a move designed in part to send a message to US President Donald Trump about the northern country’s sovereignty.

title: Brazil Keeps Bungling Its Budget and Worrying Investors
content: An unmistakable sense of deja vu hit Brazil last week when an announcement of measures meant to shore up the nation’s budget sparked a market selloff instead.

title: RBNZ Set to Make Sixth Rate Cut and Signal Bias to More Easing
content: New Zealand’s central bank is set to cut interest rates for a sixth straight meeting and signal it’s open to further easing as US trade barriers dim the economic outlook.

title: South Africa Can Entice Investors With New Budget, Minister Says
content: South Africa can focus on rebuilding the economy and resuscitating investor interest now that the third iteration of the budget has the support of the nation’s coalition government, the infrastructure minister said.

title: Chile’s Leftist Presidential Hopefuls Spar Over SQM-Codelco Deal
content: Chile’s left-leaning presidential contenders clashed over a landmark deal signed last year between lithium supplier SQM and state-owned Codelco, highlighting differences ahead of the sector’s primary vote.

title: Israel Holds Rates as Inflation Spikes, Gaza War Escalates
content: Israel’s central bank kept interest rates on hold for the 11th time in a row, maintaining a wait-and-see stance amid increased military operations in Gaza and an uptick in inflation.

title: Lagarde Sees Opportunities to Raise Euro’s Global Profile
content: President Donald Trump’s erratic policies offer a “prime opportunity” to strengthen the euro’s international role and allow the currency bloc to enjoy more of the privileges so far reserved for the US, European Central Bank President Christine Lagarde said.

title: Shipping Bottlenecks in Europe Send a Warning to US, Asia
content: Port congestion is worsening at key gateways in northern Europe and other hubs, according to a new report which suggests trade wars could spread maritime disruptions to Asia and the US and push up shipping rates.

title: Chinese, EU Trade Heads to Meet as Trump Tariff Tensions Rise
content: Top trade officials from the European Union and China are planning to meet again early next month, another sign that both sides are stepping up engagements as they try to push back against tariff pressure from Donald Trump.

title: Moody’s Rethinks Its Rating Spectrum on the G-7
content: I’m Craig Stirling, a senior editor in Frankfurt. Today we’re looking the shift in view by Moody’s on Italy. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.

title: Swiss Desire for a Trump Trade Deal Tests Its Love for Farmers
content: The UK may have been first to clinch some sort of trade accord with the US, but Switzerland has reason to hope it’s not far behind. Earlier this month, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said both countries were “at the front of  the queue” for a deal.

title: Trump Extends Deadline for 50% Tariffs on EU Goods to July 9
content: President Donald Trump said he would extend the deadline for the European Union to face 50% tariffs until July 9 after a phone call with Commission President Ursula von der Leyen.

title: Romania Boosts Liquidity to Calm Markets After Rates Spike
content: Romania’s central bank injected the highest amount of liquidity to the domestic market in almost seven years as it sought to bring down short-term interest rates that spiked because of recent political turmoil.

title: Hungary Warns Wage-Hike Plan at Risk From Weak Economy
content: Hungary’s government warned it may need to renegotiate minimum wage hikes planned for 2026 due to weaker-than-expected growth, in the latest downbeat economic outlook from officials.

title: ECB Faces Greater Risk Inflation Will Undershoot 2%, Simkus Says
content: There’s a growing danger that inflation will fall short of the European Central Bank’s 2% target, according to Governing Council member Gediminas Simkus.

title: Japan’s Stocks Solid as Trump Rhetoric Cools; Nippon Steel Gains
content: Japanese shares gained for a second day on hopes of softer trade policies from US President Donald Trump, after he extended the deadline for higher duties on European Union goods and backed a deal between Nippon Steel Corp. and US Steel Corp.

title: African Central Banks to Join EM Peers Easing Rates
content: Central banks in key African economies are getting set to line up with other emerging-markets in coming weeks and cut interest rates where inflation pressures are seen abating, or stay on guard where the path is less clear.

title: Japan to Sell Rice Stockpiles With Aim to Halve Soaring Prices
content: Japan will sell additional stockpiles of rice at a fixed price with an aim to halve soaring costs, newly-appointed agriculture minister Shinjiro Koizumi said as the country heads toward a summer election.

title: Israel Set to Hold Rates as Inflation Spikes, Gaza War Escalates
content: Israel’s central bank is set to keep interest rates on hold for the 11th time in a row, amid increased military operations in Gaza and an uptick in inflation.

title: BYD Shares Extend Losses as Price Cuts Throw Spotlight on Sales
content: BYD Co. shares extended losses in Hong Kong trading Tuesday — taking their two-day slide to more than 10% — as last week’s sweeping price cuts stoked concern of another wave of discounting in China’s cutthroat electric car market.

title: Europe Car Sales Slip as Economic Woes Hold Back Consumers
content: European car sales dipped in April as weaker economic growth and uncertainty due to global trade tensions prompted consumers to hold off on larger purchases.

title: China’s Industrial Profit Growth Picks Up Despite US Tariffs
content: China’s industrial firms saw their profits increase at a faster pace in April, as a government trade-in program drove demand for manufactured products in the face of pressure from higher US tariffs.

title: Chinese Solar Giant Longi Founder Li Steps Back as Losses Deepen
content: The founder of one of China’s biggest solar manufacturers, Longi Green Energy Technology Co., will stand down from his role overseeing day-to-day operations, as deepening losses plague the company and its peers across the sector.

title: Chinese Plastics Buyers Resist Switch Back to US Propane Despite Pause in Trade War
content: Chinese plastics factories left without US raw material when trade relations collapsed earlier this year are holding back from returning to many of those suppliers despite a pause in hostilities, underscoring the difficulty in restoring commercial ties between the world’s two largest economies.

title: Ivanhoe Slumps After Withdrawing Congo Copper Mine Guidance
content: Ivanhoe Mines Ltd. shares slumped the most in 12 years after it withdrew cost and production guidance for Africa’s largest copper mine, where further seismic activity has halted some underground operations.

title: Wildfires Erupt Near Alberta Oil Well Sites Amid Hot Weather
content: Hot weather sparked a string of wildfires around Alberta over the weekend, including some near oil and gas wells operated by Canadian Natural Resources Ltd. and others.

title: Luxury Tokyo Penthouse Sold for Over $65 Million in Booming Market
content: A Tokyo penthouse developed by Swedish buyout firm EQT AB has sold for about ¥9.5 billion ($67 million), shedding light on the cost of buying into the city’s booming high-end property market.

title: Charterhouse Sells Gelato Maker Casa Optima to Terlos
content: Charterhouse Capital Partners has agreed to sell Casa Optima, a gelato and pastry ingredient maker, to a group of investors led by consumer-focused private equity firm Terlos, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: ‘Lilo & Stitch,’ ‘Mission: Impossible’ Fuel Memorial Day Record
content: The twin releases of Walt Disney Co.’s Lilo & Stitch and Paramount Global’s Mission: Impossible — The Final Reckoning lifted US and Canadian theater ticket sales to $326.7 million through Monday, setting a box office record for the Memorial Day holiday weekend.

title: Italy’s Banco BPM Appeals UniCredit Bid Delay in Escalation
content: Banco BPM SpA is seeking to reverse a decision to suspend UniCredit SpA’s tender offer for the smaller rival, further escalating the tensions around the deal.

title: CaixaBank Pushes Back on Opposition to Spanish Banks in Portugal
content: The head of CaixaBank SA’s Portuguese unit sought to refute criticism that Spanish banks have too much influence in the country, saying their investment was vital in strengthening Portugal’s finance industry when others pulled back.

title: South Africa Has Too Many Retail Stores, Pick n Pay CEO Says
content: South African retailers are opening too many new stores, putting their financial viability at risk, according to Pick n Pay Stores Ltd. Chief Executive Officer Sean Summers.

title: Four Ex-VW Managers Convicted in Germany Over Diesel Scandal
content: Four former Volkswagen AG managers were convicted by a German court for their roles in the diesel-emission scandal, involving the manipulation of millions of cars and causing €2.1 billion ($2.4 billion) in damages to drivers.

title: Greece Hooks Up Undersea Power Link to Crete as Part of Mediterranean Grid Plans
content: ATHENS, Greece (AP) — Greece announced Monday it has completed the work on an undersea power cable link connecting the mainland to the island of Crete, a key step in its ambitious plan for a wider expansion of the grid in the Eastern Mediterranean that will eventually include Cyprus and Israel.

title: Thyssenkrupp Plans to End Conglomerate Era in Bid for Turnaround
content: Thyssenkrupp AG plans to transform itself into a holding company with majority stakes in standalone business units, marking the end of its era as a fully integrated industrial conglomerate.

title: Shipping Bottlenecks in Europe Send a Warning to US, Asia
content: Port congestion is worsening at key gateways in northern Europe and other hubs, according to a new report which suggests trade wars could spread maritime disruptions to Asia and the US and push up shipping rates.

title: Volvo Car Plans to Cut 3,000 Jobs After Profit Plunge
content: Volvo Car AB plans to eliminate around 7% of its global workforce as the Swedish carmaker cuts costs to counter muted demand and protect profits.

title: Indian Steel Tycoon’s Pathway to Mozambique Coal Deal Reopens
content: India’s largest steelmaker can proceed with the acquisition of a coal deposit in Mozambique after the seller recovered the concession rights from the country’s new government.

title: Malaysia, Singapore Explore Importing Wind Energy from Vietnam
content: Major power companies in Singapore, Malaysia and Vietnam have agreed to explore renewable energy links across their borders, as Southeast Asia takes steps to realize its long-held vision of a regional supergrid.

title: Lombard Odier, Hong Leong Team Up for Southeast Asia Wealth
content: Lombard Odier struck its seventh partnership in Asia as the Swiss wealth manager tied up with Hong Leong Bank Bhd., a move that underscores how financial firms are expanding to cater to the rising wealth in the region.

title: Indonesia Trims Gas, Backs Renewables in National Power Plan
content: Indonesia aims to boost the buildout of renewable energy in its latest national power plan, scaling back gas additions to the grid.

title: AfDB Presidential Hopeful Eyes $4.5 Trillion in Private Capital
content: Africa should tap domestic private capital to fund development and reduce reliance on costly international borrowing, said a contender for the African Development Bank presidency.

title: Chinese EV Stocks Tumble After BYD Slashes Prices as Much as 34%
content: BYD Co. led Chinese electric vehicle stocks lower in Hong Kong on Monday, as investors digested the auto giant’s sweeping price cuts of as much as 34% late last week.

title: Healthscope Receives Funding From CBA to Keep Hospitals Running
content: Australia’s biggest bank has stepped in to provide funding to hospital operator Healthscope Ltd. as the government said it wouldn’t provide a bailout.

title: Country Garden Bank Creditors Warn of Deal Breaker on Debt Plan
content: Chinese developer Country Garden Holdings Co.’s efforts to win backing for a $14.1 billion offshore restructuring are running into resistance as key bank creditors say failure to accept some of their demands would be a “deal breaker.”

title: VietJet, Airbus Sign New Order for 20 A330neo Widebody Aircraft
content: VietJet Aviation JSC has doubled its order for Airbus SE widebody aircraft, ordering 20 more A330neos, to bolster its expansion plans over the next decade.

title: Stirling Square Sells French Perfume Bottle Maker Verescence
content: Stirling Square Capital Partners has sold Verescence, a French glass packaging maker for the perfumery and cosmetics industry, to Movendo Capital and asset manager Draycott.

title: China’s Ambassador Warns Australia Over Port of Darwin Lease
content: China’s ambassador to Australia has warned Canberra to be careful in its handling of the lease of a strategically important port, after Prime Minister Anthony Albanese pledged to bring it back into his country’s hands.

title: Racer Kyle Larson Crashes at Coca-Cola 600 and Indy 500
content: CONCORD, N.C. (AP) — Kyle Larson’s day went from bad to worse Sunday night at the Charlotte Motor Speedway, leaving the talented young driver unsure if he will attempt to run “The Double” again.
